description: A unique identifier for each request that also serves as a customer's report number for tracking purposes

If the request has been determined to be a duplicate of an existing, open request, the original request is the parent and subsequent requests are children. All children will have the service_request_id of the parent in this field.
If the request is managed in the City's SAP system, this field will contain a unique identifier for the request used within SAP.
The date and time when the service request was made
The number of days, rounded to the nearest whole day, between request submission and request closure
A higher-level grouping of service names that corresponds to the City staff group responsible for responding to the request
A classification of the type of service to be performed
Further detail on the type of service to be performed
The date and time when the service request was last modified. For requests with a status of closed or referred, this will be the date the request was closed or referred.
The current state of the service request
Latitude for request location
Longitude for request location
Street address for request location
ZIP code for request location
If available, the council district where the service was requested
If available, a numeric code corresponding to the community where the service was requested
If available, the community name where the service was requested
If applicable, the park or open space area where the service was requested
Method by which the requestor submitted the request
When a case has a status of referred, this field indicates to where the case was referred
City asset functional location in current asset management system
City asset functional location in legacy asset management system
The description submitted by the reporting party
Detail on the type of illegal dumping service request. This field is only available in the illegal dumping specific dataset.
